Design an efficient algorithm to find the shortest path that visits all nodes in a weighted graph without revisiting any node, given that you can only move between nodes that have a direct edge connecting them. Provide a time complexity analysis and discuss the trade-offs between memory usage, edge cases, and real-world applications.
conversation_history.answer: So, in terms of memory, DFS uses memory proportional to the recursion depth of stack size. In the worst case, it would be OFV. BFS uses Q and Mace to all nodes at a particular level. In the worst case, like very wide graph, it can use OFV memory. And DISTRAZ requires distance array of V priority key up to OFV. So, graph representation of V plus E.
